speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text_entry: ACT I

speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text_entry: PROLOGUE

speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text_entry: Enter Chorus

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: O for a Muse of fire, that would ascend

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: The brightest heaven of invention,

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: A kingdom for a stage, princes to act

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: And monarchs to behold the swelling scene!

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: Then should the warlike Harry, like himself,

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: Assume the port of Mars; and at his heels,

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: Leash'd in like hounds, should famine, sword and fire

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: Crouch for employment. But pardon, and gentles all,

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: The flat unraised spirits that have dared

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: On this unworthy scaffold to bring forth

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: So great an object: can this cockpit hold

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: The vasty fields of France? or may we cram

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: Within this wooden O the very casques

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: That did affright the air at Agincourt?

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: O, pardon! since a crooked figure may

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: Attest in little place a million;

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: And let us, ciphers to this great accompt,

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: On your imaginary forces work.

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: Suppose within the girdle of these walls

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: Are now confined two mighty monarchies,

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: Whose high upreared and abutting fronts

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: The perilous narrow ocean parts asunder:

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: Piece out our imperfections with your thoughts;

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: Into a thousand parts divide on man,

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: And make imaginary puissance;

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: Think when we talk of horses, that you see them

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: Printing their proud hoofs i' the receiving earth;

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: For 'tis your thoughts that now must deck our kings,

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: Carry them here and there; jumping o'er times,

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: Turning the accomplishment of many years

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: Into an hour-glass: for the which supply,

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: Admit me Chorus to this history;

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: Who prologue-like your humble patience pray,

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: Gently to hear, kindly to judge, our play.

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: Exit
